intro: Iranecio hypochionaeus var. argaeus, commonly known as the Argaeus variant of the Iranecio hypochionaeus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Iran. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in a compact rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant species within its native range.
